intro: Tournefortia astrotricha, commonly known as the star-shaped tournefortia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, star-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of yellow and orange. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a velvety texture. Tournefortia astrotricha is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy, well-drained soils.
